timeline.bodyText: Any reason why you are splitting up these symbols into different appends? Seems like they could be a single one(since you are not doing any newlines)

timeline.message:
Add names next to scores in FFA in /match and sort by score.

Signed-off-by: mrcookie <athertonmook@gmail.com>

Add names next to scores in FFA in /match and sort by score.

Signed-off-by: mrcookie <athertonmook@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText:
You can simplify this using a reducer instead of a collector:
    TextComponent result =
        this.scores.entrySet().stream()
            .sorted(Map.Entry.comparingByValue(Comparator.reverseOrder()))
            .limit(10)
            .reduce(
                TextComponent.builder(),
                (builder, entry) ->
                    builder
                        .append(entry.getKey().getName(NameStyle.VERBOSE))
                        .append(": ", TextColor.GRAY)
                        .append("" + entry.getValue().intValue(), TextColor.WHITE),
                ComponentBuilder::append)
            .build();
timeline.author: Pablete1234

replies.bodyText: Well, I need the output to be a list, so I can use TextFormatter.list(...) to list the names in a nice format: Player1, Player2, ... , and PlayerN. Using a collector seems like the proper way right?
replies.author: mrcookieunderscore13

replies.bodyText: A joining collector may be a better alternative then, look at how the Collectors.joining collector works for strings and do a similar one for this
replies.author: Pablete1234

replies.bodyText: Using Collectors.joining, there is no easy way to have the last element separated like <element n-1>, and <element n>, rather than just a comma. I don't understand what is wrong with the method I am currently using.
replies.author: mrcookieunderscore13

replies.bodyText: @mrcookieunderscore13 Maybe you are looking for something like what is in TextFormatter#list ?
replies.author: KingOfSquares

replies.bodyText: @KingOfSquares I do use that method. I use the stream to make an ordered list of the players, and then a few lines down use TextFormatter#list to format it properly.
replies.author: mrcookieunderscore13

replies.bodyText: Right, then I think I misunderstood the argument between you and Pablo
replies.author: KingOfSquares
